Text: #G02# As a UI designer, I want to begin user testing, so that I can validate stakeholder UI improvement requests.
#G02# As a FABS user, I want to download the uploaded FABS file, so that I can get the uploaded file.
#G02# As a UI designer, I want to move on to round 2 of Homepage edits, so that I can get approvals from leadership.
#G02# As a broker team member, I want to make some updates to the SQL codes for clarity.
#G02# As a user, I want to access the raw agency published files from FABS via USAspending.
#G02# As an owner, I want to be sure that USAspending only send grant records to my system.
#G02# As a UI designer, I want to move on to round 3 of the Help page edits, so that I can get approvals from leadership.
#G02# As a broker team member, I want to ensure the Broker resources, validations, and P&P pages are updated appropriately for the launch of FABS and DAIMS v1.1.
#G02# As a UI designer, I want to track the issues that come up in Tech Thursday, so that I know what to test and what want s to be fixed.
#G02# As an Agency user, I want to be able to include a large number of flexfields without performance impact.
#G02# As a Website user, I want to access published FABS files, so that I can see the new files as they come in.
#G02# As a data user, I want to see the office names derived from office codes, so that I can have appropriate context for understanding them.
#G02# As a Developer , I want to determine how agencies will generate and validate D Files from FABS and FPDS data.
#G02# As a Developer I want to quickly access Broker application data, so that I can investigate issues.
#G02# As a UI designer, I want to schedule user testing, so that I can give the testers advanced notice to ensure buy-in.
#G02# As an agency user, I want to leave off the last 4 digits of the ZIP without an error, so that I can complete my submissions.
#G02# As a Developer, I want to prevent users from double publishing FABS submissions after refreshing, so that there are no duplicates.
#G02# As a Developer , I want to clarify to users what exactly is triggering the CFDA error code in each case.
#G02# As a FABS user, I want to have read-only access to DABS, so that I can view DABS pages without wanting two sets of permissions.

#G03# As a Plan Review Staff member, I want to Track the Completion of Required Plan Reviews, so that I can ensure all plan review tasks are completed, results have been sent to the Applicant and any downstream steps are initiated such has a final review or payment for permit issuance.
#G03# As an Applicant, I want to Complete Building Development Project, so that I can receive any posted bond and/or obtain occupancy.

#G03# As a Zoning Staff member, I want to Process the Requests for Zoning Information, so that I can capture my response to the request in the system and also send a communication from the system to the Applicant.
#G03# As a Customer, I want to Create a Customer Portal User Account, so that I can log on to the Customer Portal and perform transactions that first require user authentication.
#G03# As an Inspection Supervisor, I want to Manage Inspector Workload, so that I can meet service level and quality requirements.
#G03# As a Planning Staff member, I want to Evaluate Consistency with the Comprehensive Plan, so that I can complete my required review of a plan set and/or application.
#G03# As a Staff member, I want to Perform a Completeness Review, so that I can validate when an application is complete and eligible for further technical review.
#G03# As a Staff member, I want to Manage Affidavits, so that I can ensure compliance with the requirements prior to the hearing.
#G03# As a Staff member, I want to Record an Internal Note, so that I can share information with other Staff collaborating on the record.
#G03# As an Applicant, I want to Pay Fee, so that I can satisfy outstanding charge associated with the service requested or received from the County.
#G03# As a Plan Review Staff member, I want to Assign Plans for Review, so that I can ensure plans have been assigned to the appropriate Plan Reviewer.
#G04# As a user, I want to add donation centers as favorites on my profile, so that I can view them later.
#G04# As an admin, I want to view user error logs, so that I can fix or review any issues that are being faced by users of the system.
#G04# As a user, I want to be able to view the safe disposal events currently being organised around my area.
#G04# As a company, I want to have a website that is easy to use, so that I can upload or delete stuff step by step.
#G04# As a user, I want to contact the administrators, so that I can give feedback or ask for help.
#G04# As a user, I want to click on the address, so that it takes me to a new tab with Google Maps.
#G04# As an admin, I want to be able to add or remove recycling facilities' information, so that users get the most recent information.
#G04# As a user, I want to be able to give my email ID, so that I can receive notifications for new events as they are posted.
#G04# As a user, I want to be able to view a map display of the public recycling bins around my area.
#G04# As a user, I want to link my email account to my profile, so that I can get a temporary password in case I forget my own one.
#G05# As a Data Publishing User, I want to be able to import data in Excel, So that I do not have to convert data formats in order to use the data packager.
#G05# As an API user, I want to be able to change the colors of the embedded visualisations in my own platform, So that I can customize the visualisations.
#G05# As a Data Consuming User, I want to be able to filter, sort and aggregate data by multiple dimensions and measures, So that I can get more granular views on the data.
#G05# As a Data Consuming User, I want to be able to have stepped zoom on map visualisations, So that I can have better control over the navigation experience inside a map view.
#G05# As a Developer, I want to be able to customise the Brand Name and Icon, and Primary Color of all frontend Javascript apps, So that I can customise the branding for my own needs.
#G05# As a Data Publishing User, I want to be able to edit the data source of data I have already imported, So that I can fix bugs or make enhancements in the API built for my data.
#G05# As an API User, I want to be able to normalise measures by population, So that I work with datasets in reference to their contextual constraints.
#G05# As a Data Consuming User, I want to be able to search any dataset published and publicly accessible by their title and metadata, So that I can find the datasets I'm interested in.

#G05# As a Data Consuming User, I want to visualize by default in treemap, bubble tree, map and pivot table the most recent year when my dataset contain multiple years, So that I'm not confused with the amounts.
#G05# As a Data Publishing User, I want to know if my CSV file is valid, So that I can fix possible data issues before publishing it on Open Spending.
#G08# As a publisher, I want to embed an interactive preview of my data on my site, so that users can be encouraged that this is the correct data for them.
#G08# As a Researcher, I want to get a Data Package into Julia in seconds, so that I can start using the data for doing analysis and visualizations.
#G08# As a Developer, I want to get a Data Package into Julia in seconds, so that I can start using the data in doing analysis and visualizations.
#G08# As a Researcher, I want to get my Excel spreadsheet into a Data Package, so that I can benefit from better tooling and standardization.
#G08# As a ResearcherGovernment Publisher, I want to add general country names to my dataset that only contains country codes, so that my dataset is more readable.
#G08# As a Developer, I want to get a Data Package into C++ in seconds, so that I can start using the data in doing analysis and visualizations.
#G08# As a government Publisher, I want to make it easy to prove that our published data is valid, so that I can claim that we are living up to our transparency commitments.
#G08# As a publisher, I want to package reproducible steps to get a certain data state, so my methodology is transparent and can be rerun by others.
#G08# As a Researcher, I want to be able to save new visualizations, so that I can share them with others or include them in the Data Package.
#G08# As a Developer, I want to do exploratory data analysis in R and operationalize that analysis in Python, so that I can use the best tool for the job.
#G08# As a ResearcherPublisher, I want to know that my data conforms to its Data Package profile, so that I can feel trust in the validity and usefulness of the data.
#G08# As a Developer, I want to get a Data Package into Python in seconds, so that I can start using the data for doing analysis and visualizations.
#G08# As a Developer, I want to get a Data Package into Node, so that I can start using the data for doing analysis and visualizations.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to view a section of the website that teaches me the basics of what Scrum is, so that I can learn that quickly.
#G10# As a site editor, I want to have a prominent area on the home page where I can put special announcements not necessarily news or articles, so that I can give them additional exposure.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to access old news that is no longer on the home page, so that I can access things I remember from the past or that others mention to me.
#G10# As a CSM, I want to be charged a fee once I am approved for Practitioner status, so that my certification status can be activated.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to view lists on the site of all Certified Scrum Masters, Practitioners, Trainers, and Certified Scrum Product Owners.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of all upcoming Certification Courses and can page through them if there are a lot, so that I can choose the best course for me.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to see a list of all upcoming Events, so that I can decide if I want to attend any.
#G10# As a site administrator, I want to create an Other Course or Event that is not charged a listing fee, so that the Scrum Alliance doesn't charge itself for Scrum Gatherings that it puts on.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to see new content when I come to the site, so that I come back more often.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to read a new article on the front page about once a week, so that I am up on all the latest happenings.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to click the link from the article teaser to take me directly to the body of the article. not to another teaser setup, so that I can easily finish the article.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to do a full-text search of article body, title, and author name, so that I can find what I want.
#G10# As a site member, I want to download the latest training material and methodology PDFs, so that I have them.
#G10# As a site visitor, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of articles, so that I can read them without visiting the site.
#G10# As a trainer, I want to turn a course into an event or an event into a course, so that I can correctly classify anything that was entered incorrectly.
#G10# As a site admin, I want to delete any course or event, so that I can remove things that will no longer occur.
#G10# As a site member, I want to mark my email address as private even if the rest of my profile is not, so that no one can contact me.
#G10# As a site member, I want to subscribe to an RSS feed of news, so that I remain sufficiently and easily informed.
#G10# As the site editor, I want to have pretty good control over how the article, so that articles are visually appealing.
#G11# As a content editor, I want to be able to easily find content, so that I can edit it.
#G11# As a user, I want to add a video to my article.
#G11# As a team member, I want to have a prioritized list of features and elements of a future social element page, so that I can work with the engineers to determine feasibility.
#G11# As a VisualDesigner, I want to create a moodboard to aid with visual design concepts for the nsf.gov website, so that we can discuss different design concepts with stakeholders.
#G11# As a researcher, I want to develop the user research protocol for internal workflows, so that we can begin testing against a CMS prototype.
#G11# As a team member, I want to determine a design direction for the beta social page, so that we can implement a beta site quickly without established brand guidelines.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have an updated roadmap document, so that I can see prioritized areas to focus on for the next few months and beyond.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to know where the initial in-person meeting will be, so that I can plan on attending.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to see how the user recruitment form looks and behaves on a sample page, so that I can understand the impact the recruitment will have on the NSF page.
#G11# As a content designer, I want to demonstrate the value of user-centered content design to ensure it's an integral part of our recommendations.
#G11# As a team member, I want to know what visual design related tasks we might need to plan for this sprint, so that I can assign tasks as necessary.
#G11# As a developer, I want to have the subdomain beta.nsf.gov be set up, so that I can deploy a beta site to it.
#G11# As a team member, I want to know when meetings are, so that I can plan accordingly.
#G11# As an NSF employee, I want to have high-level strategy recommendations to implement in conjunction with the new CMS.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to store camper's immediate parent/guardian's information, so that I can easily call to notify them in case a grossly unacceptable behavior.
#G12# As a parent, I want to be able to share any photos the camp has taken of my child.
#G12# As a camp worker, I'm able to report a list of supplies to the manager that the camp is short of.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to store campers' emergency information in a database, so that I can easily notify the necessary parties in case of an emergency.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to be able to keep camper records from previous years, so that the amount of work I need to do is lowered.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to be able to delete tasks/activities I scheduled, so that I can keep the schedule clean of unneeded activities.
#G12# As a parent, I want to be able to message my child's counselors, so that I can voice my concerns or check on my child's progress.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to be able to see only events for a specific group/groups on the event calendar, so that I can easily read the data on the calendar without too much clutter.
#G12# As a camp administrator, I want to be able to create, modify rules that campers and camp workers has to follow.
#G12# As a camp worker, I'm able to report a camper to the manager with an inappropriate behavior.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to enter the agreed-upon estimate, so that we can move on to the next item when we agree.
#G13# As a Mike, I want to be able to see some metrics on use of the game, so that I can see how much it is being used.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to copy/paste stories from a spreadsheet, so that I can get started more quickly.
#G13# As a participant, I want to be able to change my estimate up until the last person selects a card and all are shown, so that I can change my mind based on information I hear.
#G13# As a user, I want to be able to use Unicode, so that I can use any language I like.
#G13# As a user, I want to see sensible and predictable URLs, so that the application feels logical and transparent.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to delete my account, so that account information and games are no longer stored.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to export a transcript of a game as a CSV file, so that I can further process the stories and estimates.
#G13# As a developer, I want to have a list of definitions for commonly used terms, so that everyone working on the project can understand each other more easily.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to add an item to the list of items to be estimated, so that so that we can be flexible and accommodate situations where we think of a new story while playing.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to validate the data I am about to publish to the registry, so that that I publish good data and know that I am doing.
#G14# As a consumer, I want to view the data package, so that that I can get a sense of whether I want this dataset or not.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to download the data package in one file, so that that I don't have to download descriptor and each resource by hand.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a data package in the UI, so that that it is available and published.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to get a sense of the age of the datapackage that I have downloaded before, so that that I can decide if I should update or not.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to search based on description of data package, so that that I can find package which related to some key words.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to create a data package in the UI so that it is available and published.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to view a Datapackage at a particular version online, so that that I can present/discuss the particular data timeslice of interest with other people.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to permanently delete a data package, so that that it no longer takes up storage space.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to see some example data packages quickly, so that I get a sense of what is on this site and if it is useful to look further.
#G14# As a Web Developer, I want to be able to install multiple versions of the same datapackage separately, so that that all my projects could be developed independently and deployed locally.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to preview a datapackage I have prepared, so that that I can check it works and share the results.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to have private data packages, so that I can share just with my team.
#G16# As a collection curator, I want to see the referers for visitors who use resolver-abstracted links to reach my items.
#G16# As a collection curator, I want to restrict access to my collection or items to Duke IP addresses.
#G16# As a visitor, I want to see the embargo status and release date clearly displayed and perhaps highlighted in some way.
#G17# As a user, I want to update the properties of a dataset instance and I expect this to fail if the new properties are not compatible with a meaningful error message.
#G17# As an app developer, I want to explore a dataset instance of a type that was deployed as part of an app.
#G17# As a user, I want to specify schema as a SQL schema string.
#G17# As an app developer, I want to ensure that application redeployment fails if any of its datasets cannot be reconfigured.
#G17# As an app developer, I want to only depend on the interface of a dataset type in my app and have the system inject the implementation at runtime.
#G17# As a dataset developer, I want to have an archetype that helps me package my dataset type properly.
#G17# As a user, I want to remove a single property of a dataset instance without knowing all other properties.

#G17# As a plugin developer, I want to include the code for a dataset type in the plugin artifact, so that when a pipeline using this plugin is created a dataset instance of that type is created and it is explorable and available to apps.
#G17# As a user, I want to configure time-to-live in a uniform way across all dataset types.

#G17# As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy a new version of an app that includes a different version of a dataset type deployed by another app and this app shares a dataset instance of this type with the other app the deployment will fail with a version conflict error.
#G17# As a hydrator user, I want to ensure that all dataset instances created by apps are available as sinks and sources for pipelines.

#G17# As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy a new version of an app that includes an older version of a dataset type deployed by another app and I expect that the dataset instances created by this app use the dataset type code included in this app.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have the system to provide standard metadata, that all researchers in the centre (and beyond) can use, so that we can better understand each others' data.

#G18# As a researcher, I want to have any data that I have written to the VRE to be protected from modification or deletion, so that original data can always be traced back to an experiment and a point in time.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have the ability to form links between objects, for example File A is an analysis of File B, so that data can be searched by type and by association.
#G18# As a user, I want to have a spreadsheet hosted within the Neurohub Web page, so that I can edit and calculate costs collaboratively with others while working on the proposal.
#G18# As a user, I want to associate together files involved in a experiment.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have the ability to insert Greek symbols into my logbook entries.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have physiology images to be annotated with standard meta data, so that my data can later be searched for and understood.
#G18# As a user, I want to modify or branch an experimental protocol, whilst retaining the original.
#G18# As a system administrator, I want to migrate data from an older version of NeuroHub to the current version.
#G18# As a user, I want to revert to an older version of an uploaded file.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have a timeline display of multiple data files and their associated images, so that I can compare the data taken from experiments on particular dates.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have at least some meta data to be automatically inserted when new data is added to the system.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to upload files prior to having them attached to a log book page using a mapped network drive.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have electronic support for keeping track of which data sets were used/output/modified as part of a particular experiment.
#G18# As a user, I want to have a visual way of viewing particular files uploaded over a time period.

#G18# As a researcher, I want to associate meta data to the group as a whole at some point in time after the bulk upload has completed, so that I have a period of time to reflect on suitable values for the meta data.
#G18# As a user, I want to draw tables using HTML tags as part of the content of a log book page.
#G18# As a user, I want to either keep a logbook entry private or share it with individuals rather than groups.
#G18# As an investigator, I want to view the acceptance test results, so that I can understand how feature-complete the Neurohub node currently is.

#G18# As a release engineer, I want to configure nightly builds that automatically perform a Neurohub installation on a virgin operating system, execute tests and report back results, without requiring any manual input/interaction.
#G19# As an InformalCaregiver, I want to have a game that the carer could play together with the user, so that it would enable to monitor the users’ state of health but also have some fun time.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to be able to see whether I already have taken my pills, so that I can avoid an overdose.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to have a regular summary on how much exercise is performed by the user.
#G19# As a developer, I want to present my app to as many people as Possible.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to have ALFRED contact the nearest caregiver when I ask ALFRED for urgent help.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to use ALFRED to maintain my contact list in my phone.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to have ALFRED on a bracelet or a necklace, so that I can always wear him with me.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to be able to zoom into visual content.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to have ALFRED to remind me to keep a good body posture.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to use ALFRED to help me navigate despite my mild cognitive impairments.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to have video conversation with others.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to receive suggestions about local sport Classes.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to have feedback on the activity level of the user.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to have ALFRED to propose training that promotes complex thinking.
#G19# As a developer, I want to have detailed information of what happened when my App crashes on the user’s device.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to receive support to use the public transport.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to insert my meetings into ALFRED using speech.
#G19# As a developer, I want to present my App in several ways.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to have ALFRED to remind people to exercise regularly.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to do guided exercises with ALFRED and ALFRED should also use sensors to capture health data while I am doing exercises.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to use video calls in case of emergency.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to have ALFRED to be able to determine the user's breathing frequency.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to use ALFRED to control the TV and radio.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to receive a reminder from ALFRED on all the things I need to bring with me when I leave the house.
#G19# As a MedicalCaregiver, I want to be able to see if the patient has taken her medicine.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to games that require the combination of mental and physical exercise, such as opposing motion exercises of the arms and legs.
#G19# As an OlderPerson, I want to use ALFRED for navigation.
#G21# As a administrator, I want to bulk approve sessions as accepted, so that I can save time.
#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to have a link on the home page to a list of training options, so that I can take training.

#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to see specific details on summits, so that I can learn more about the summit I'm interested in to see if it matches my interests, register for the event, and get day-of knowledge to help me get to the location.
#G21# As a summit coordinator, I want to see a list of attendees signed up for my summit, so that I can communicate with my attendees by email prior to the event.
#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to learn about posting jobs as a sponsor and contact the sponsorship person, so that I have the opportunty to post my job listing on the BADCamp site.
#G21# As a trainee, I want to limit to one registration per day per authenticated user, so that we don't have duplicate spaces.

#G21# As a authenticateduser, I want to identify myself as and pay for a $350 company sponsorship, so that I can easily become a sponsor at this level without having to interface with badcamp personnel to get a sponsorship.
#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to see a list of the sessions associated with sponsor attendees, so that I know where I can engage with this sponsor and where they are thought leaders.
#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to receive a notification when sessions have been evaluated, so that I know whether I've been accepted or rejected.
#G21# As a anonymoususer, I want to sign up for the BADCamp newsletter, so that I can stay up to date with the latest communications about BADCamp.
#G21# As a authenticateduser, I want to view the job board, so that I can look for an interesting Drupal gig!.
#G21# As a trainingcoordinator, I want to have an admin view where all trainee information is shown and can be filtered to show a single training session, so that I can see WTF is happening.
#G21# As a sponsor, I want to post a job, so that I can hire top-tier Drupal talent.
#G22# As a repository operator, I want to know about the kind of data, so that I can evaluate the storage size and system.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know which kind of data types will be produced or collected, so that I can determine what basic support services and functionalities are required.
#G22# As a metadata manager, I want to have a short description of project, so that I can be informed about the metadata description.
#G22# As a PI, I want to properly record all metadata, so that I can ensure proper running of the project in case of staff changes.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know whether the data can be reproduced efficiently, so that I can determine whether and how the data has to be stored.
#G22# As a researcher, I want to link research publications in the institutional repository or CRIS with DMP records, so that I can generate reports of research output resulting from a project.
#G22# As a PI, I want to record information about my DMP, so that an Ethics Committee can review this for compliance with ethical standards.
#G22# As a PI, I want to plan what kind of data I want to record/store, so that I can ensure it will possible to store it.
#G22# As a researcher, I want to record my intention to share data I have collected under terms of a particular licence, so that other researchers who use the data understand the rights of use.
#G22# As a researcher, I want to extract the description of the data collected, so that I can reuse it for the writing of a data paper.
#G22# As a research head, I want to access to the persistent identifiers of datasets provided in the DMP, so that I can check that the DMP has been implemented.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know the time plan for collecting data, so that I can plan the data management.
#G22# As an archivemanager, I want to reuse the information regarding file format, so that I can apply automated checks for the file validation.
#G22# As an IT staff member, I want to know which kind of data types will be produced or collected, so that I can determine what basic support services and functionalities are required.
#G22# As an IT staff member, I want to know with which software or technology the data is produced or used, so that I can determine what kind of technical services and functionalities are required.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know the security requirements of the data, so that I can check whether the data can be kept secure.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to assign a Level of description to a Resource or Resource Component and optionally specify another value if the Level is not in a predefined list.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to upload an EAD for import from within the frontend application.
#G23# As an Application Administrator, I want to assign Users to an Advanced Data Entry and ensure that the appropriate permissions are enforced.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Agent records.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Event records.
#G23# As a Repository Manager , I want to create, update and delete any records in my repository.
#G23# As a user, I want to add additional properties for repositories.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to associate a Subject record with a Resource description.
#G23# As a Developer , I want to develop a custom importer.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to import EAD files that were exported by the Archivists' Toolkit.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to add Notes to other record types.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Virtual Research Environments and other workflow tools, so that I can continue to work with tools with which I'm familiar.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to place data under an embargo, so that my right of first use is protected, and I can fulfil my confidentiality responsibilities.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to attach subject specific discoverability metadata to records, so that researchers in my discipline can find my data more easily.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to link datasets with the project DMP, so that compliance with DMP can be demonstrated and whole project workflow is linked together.
#G24# As a Research Information manager, I want to have datasets linked to metadata about projects, so that I can report on projects depositing datasets in relation to funder requirements.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to manage multiple versions of the same dataset, so that changes to the dataset are transparent and do not compromise research integrity.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to allow my collaborators privileged access to datasets, so that we continue to have a productive relationship.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit the files that I have, so that I don't have to spend a lot of time finding the right version and converting to the right format.
#G24# As a data reuser, I want to access the system in my native language, so that I am not put off reusing University of Bath data by language barriers.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Pure, so that I have a single onestop shop for managing my research outputs.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to know all the collections and objects in the DAMS for which I have custodial responsibility.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know if application of a library policy to an object or object component has been modified, either manually or automatically.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to track all events scheduled for recording in the DAMS.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to say one collection is related to another collection.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know all the statutes pertinent to an object or object component.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know when the application of a statute to an object or object component has been modified, either manually or automatically.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know if an object or object component is subject to a library policy that restricts access in any way.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate other descriptions of the collection that are outside the DAMS and of probable importance to users.
#G25# As a user, I want to see the geographical context of a collection, object, or object component, where pertinent.
#G25# As a user, I want to know about other versions of the object or its metadata that might be of use to me.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to know all events occurring to a component over its life cycle.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to provide a title, in all useful forms, for my repository's collections, objects, and object components.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to indicate to preservation managers the checksum and checksum method for each master file for a given object.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to describe each component as necessary, including title, date(s), language(s), and other facets.
#G25# As a user, I want to scope my searches for collections, objects, or object components to a specific language.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to present collections, objects, and object components by title.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to describe a collection, including its title, it's inclusive / bulk dates, its language(s), and many other aspects.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to list all the components, in their appropriate order, for an object.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate subjects that are related to an object.
#G25# As a user, I want to be able to see and navigate the component hierarchy of an object.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to automatically generate technical metadata, so that I know the file size.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to assign rights to user groups or roles, so that I can control what users can and can't do.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to locate photographs and documents that I can share on social media.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to automatically assign unique identifiers to material I scan, so that I avoid potential errors.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to see common material across collections, so that so I can prepare a comprehensive analysis.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to limit who can see certain metadata fields, so that I can show or hide things from display based on user groups.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to know the date on which something was digitized, so that I know if it's been digitized since I last looked.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to share a link to a file on social media, so that so I can show other people an interesting thing I found.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to have researchers reset their own passwords, so that I don't have to send passwords in cleartext.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to generate structured citation data, so that so I can cite a file in a publication.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to make as much archival material as possible available for use, so that I can fulfill the RAC's mission.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to search index cards and other non-public finding aids, so that I can provide better research assistance.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to set a date on which restrictions will be removed from a file, so that that I don't have to update this by hand.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to link electronic versions of researchers' publications to citations, so that I can share them with other researchers.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to manage loan documentation, including preservation photos, forms and correspondence, so that I can find it easily later.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to upload inventories, so that our donor representatives have an easier time requesting their material.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to access metadata and visual representations of index cards, so that I can use that information to assist researchers.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to see what a particular user has downloaded, so that I can track use of assets.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to search all files by keyword.
#G26# As a donor representative, I want to supply incremental accruals to new and existing collections, so that material can be transferred on an ongoing basis.
#G27# As a researcher, I want to receive updates when new works are published in a given collection or by a given author, so that I can discover more of their work.

#G27# As a library staff member, I want to be able to tell the researchers I'm helping with DMPs that Cornell has a repository system I can use for archiving and sharing results of their research, so that I can easily meet the needs of funder DMP requirements.
#G27# As a researcher, I want to discover items in the repository through the library's discovery system and Google, so that I can facilitate my easy use of the content.
#G27# As a library staff member, I want to make digital items held in trusted external system searchable within our system, so that I can provide seamless access to disparate collections.

Secondary Entity: trusted external system searchable within our system

Text: #G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to manage report/dataset name changes so patrons are able to find historic reports that have a different name from current report.
#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to upload data to the repository and associate it with a publication, so that I receive attribution for my data as well as my publications.
#G27# As a library staff member, I want to have customizable metadata fields, so that each project is described in the most accurate way possible.
#G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to have a personal account with the ability to change passwords to make them more secure or to retrieve forgotten ones.

#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to easily find all the items in the repository that I have authored, by searching on my name (author name authority and/or identification issue), because I keeps my publications in the repository up-to-date and points people tithe repository.
#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to login remotely to the repository using Shibboleth, so that I can get remote access to Cornell campus-only content.
#G27# As an asset manager, I want to have mechanism to pass ownership/management of the assets to a successor.

#G27# As an Extension Educator, I want to have a place to store a variety of documents, presentations and data sets I've created, that doesn't require an extra step in making available on my own County/Region/Project site (i.e. a list or directory of materials there is automatically updated when placed in a central archive/repository).

#G27# As a student, I want to learn who at Cornell has or is engaged in research related to a particular topic, so that I can find an appropriate advisor, choose which courses to enroll in, and identify work/internship opportunities.
#G27# As a repository support team member, I want to move a collection, so that I can fulfill the collection owner's request.
#G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to manage customizable relationship groups in support of patron see also option.
#G27# As a patron, I want to email system provider to report issues and ask questions.
#G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that there is a formal plan for the disposition of assets if the IR should cease.

#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to create a collection for my documents, or my organization's documents, and apply some distinctive branding to that collection, so that I can promote my work, or that of my organization.

#G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that the redundant copies are continuously monitored for unwanted changes, and that if/when changes do occur, there is a mechanism by which I can determine the original object and restore it to all copies.
#G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to upload new version of report/dataset while retaining previous versions for patron use.
#G27# As a library staff member, I want to upload material to the repository on the author's behalf, so that I can fulfill a service obligation.
#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to associate a researcherID or ORCID with a submission, so that there is no ambiguity between my work and someone else with the same name.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to perform prefiltering of the images to remove artefacts such as bright stars and camera read errors.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to automatically detect Snapshot Serengeti images with no classifiable animals in them.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to know which piece of education I should give to a volunteer.
#G28# As a user, I want to receive content recommendations from similar profiles.
#G28# As an admin, I want to see a summary of articles, so that I reuse them.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to detect important features such as areas of flooding, damage, temporary shelters, blocked roads etc in the satellite images.
#G28# As a user, I want to search and discover music based on other users similar to myself.
#G28# As a user, I want to take a picture or upload an image, so that I am recommended with videos related to that picture or image.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to know when Zoonibot should give an explanation.
#G28# As an admin, I want to filter and rank videos based on A/V quality aspects.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to know when I should interrupt a volunteer.
#G28# As a Zooniverse admin, I want to identify the number of whales heard in a single audio file.
